name: VINE (Victim Information and Notification Everyday)
short_desc: Phone and online resource that allows victims of crime to obtain information about the custody status of their offender
description: Phone and online resource that allows victims of crime to obtain information about the custody status of their offender. Victims can call or search online for information regarding custody status, and they can also register to receive telephone and e-mail notification when their offender's custody status changes (for example, parole or clemency, release, transfer, escape or death). Service is free.VINELink is a service of VINE (Victim Information and Notification Everyday), provided by Appriss Incorporated. Alameda County VINELink site is provided by the Alameda County Sheriff's office.It is recommended not to depend solely on VINELink or any single resource for protection. It is also advised to contact local law enforcement with concerns about one's protection.
